website_summaries.verdict: Award-winning vegetarian cookbook that has earned praise from athletes and professionals in the field for its healthful recipes that are geared toward meat-free active lifestyles.
pros: Contains meatless recipes for every meal that are made with ingredients that fuel workouts, and includes recipes to make homemade sports drinks
Users brag about many of the dishes providing energy for working out and staying active
Available on Kindle and in paperback
cons: Some athletes may be surprised that the recipes don't come with detailed nutritional information that's key to their goals
Some recipes are complicated while others seem quite basic

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy kindle version!!!
customer_reviews.text: The kindle version of this book it useless. There are no sections, chapters, or index- no way to find recipes except to flip through every page, which with a physical book is annoying but doable, with a kindle impossible and aggravating.
customer_reviews.author: Amako

customer_reviews.title: Tailored for meal prep.
customer_reviews.text: Good food but not simple at all. Every recipe seems to call for soaking overnight or using a sauce from the book which takes extra time. It is in no way shape or form simple meals unless you modify and skip the sauce or spice but than where's the flavor? If you want to make food when you are hungry this is a frustrating book. It is more for meal prep planned out days ahead.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Kaiser

customer_reviews.title: No nutritional value after recipe, not like the older version.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the other version, it gave the nutritional value after the recipe. Also, i preferred the organization of the other book by the same author, seemed less clutter.
customer_reviews.author: Rewa

customer_reviews.title: Informative but unusual flavor profiles
customer_reviews.text: I really like the idea of this book, and the foreword is a really great intro to vegan eating and cooking, however a lot of the meals are complicated (multi-step type recipes where 1 recipe might reference 2-3 other recipes in the book that you also have to make for sauce, etc) and the flavors of a lot of the recipes just aren’t my taste. So far I’ve enjoyed ~40% of the recipes I have made from this book
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Watch What The Health and Buy this Book. Then feel great!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big fan of the no meat athlete and this book does not disappoint. Well done! Must buy for vegans or anyone transitioning. We certainly do not need meat to be healthy or strong. I cured my illness with a meat diet said nobody ever. Billions of animals are tortured every year for this unhealthy habit. Billions. It's unethical and unnecessary. Watch "What The Health" documentary and clean up your diet. It feels good to feel good!
customer_reviews.author: GdownTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE everything about this cookbook
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE everything about this cookbook. This book has renewed my energy in cooking. I'm an avid runner who recently converted to veganism and this book is a great resource for me to fuel my long runs in a healthy balanced way.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael

customer_reviews.title: How do you not...
customer_reviews.text: include the macro breakdown for each recipe? That's the most important part! I read while skimming that you believe that I don't even need to track protein. But that's your assumption against my ACTUAL results which I track every week. Please include the macro breakdown of each recipe because this is extremely frustrating that not a single vegetarian/vegan athlete book I buy includes this info.
customer_reviews.author: Nick R.

customer_reviews.title: MAthlete
customer_reviews.text: Plant Based recipes for ATHLETES without macronutrients or caloric information is a FAIL in my book. Most athletes pay attention to nutrition information and absolutely protein content. The recipes are creative and taste great but there is nothing to go on. I’d assume food for athletes would provide higher protein than other standard recipes? If counting the nutrients is something that falls in your discipline this will not take any work out of your routine. You will still have to figure out the information long hand. FUN. That being said the book has great information for beginners and great tips and tricks to get you up and running in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: marrykaypoppins

customer_reviews.title: No Nutrition Info with Recipes
customer_reviews.text: This is supposed to be a book for Athletes-it says so in the tile. I read his blog-it's good reading. However if you want to sell me cookbook I need nutritional info with each recipe-not my job to go out and calculate that from external sources, particularly when there is so much noise around whether or not no meat diets will provide sufficient protein. He's not alone-Tom Brady did the same thing. Both books fall far short the mark they had an opportunity to hit.
customer_reviews.author: BookAddicted

customer_reviews.title: Vegan for New Cooks
customer_reviews.text: I just received this cookbook and haven't tried any recipes yet, but I've read through it and enjoyed the notes, photos, and variety of recipes. This is good for those new to cooking on their own too, because the notes include super basics like why to stir the pasta after you've put it in boiling water, rather than leaving it alone and finding a glumpy mess of stuck together noodles later. I won't use everything in this book, but as a new vegan it's supportive and reminds me there's plenty of ideas that will fuel me.
customer_reviews.author: Becky S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Book, Great Recipes!
customer_reviews.text: Really really like this cookbook. I'm new to running and somewhat new to No Meat eating. Tried the Pineapple Black Bean Bowls on p96, wonderful and very large portions. The Garlic Rosemary Potato Soup, p114 was very tasty but the portions were a bit small for 2 when full recipe was cut in half for 2 or 3. The Switchel sports drink was good, p188 and much better than the sweet drinks on the market. Page 241 Spicy Pickled Carrots were good as a side dish but sometimes I've used it as a salad topping and dressing all in one. And don't even get me started on the Two Minute Turtles, p257, they were super simple, fast, and extraordinary!!
customer_reviews.author: katrina

customer_reviews.title: but I am so glad I did
customer_reviews.text: I have several plant based cook books that I never use so I was hesitant to get another one, but I am so glad I did. This is by far the best plant based cook book out there. Recipes are healthy and easy to make. No crazy ingredients, and works for someone on a budget. Foods I rarely eat because they are processed crap and expensive but really enjoy, like vegan sour cream and vegan nuggets, I now know how to make myself. I just can't say enough about this book! And it's definitely not just for athletes, despite the name.
customer_reviews.author: Amy E Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Missing key information
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this book and the first recipe I made was delicious (blueberry scones). That said, I was disappointed that the recipes don't include nutritional information. Since this is targets for athletes I expected this information to be there. I also expected the recipes to be a little healthier. So, while I will use this recipe book, I'll keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Gatzbee

customer_reviews.title: Must have cookbook
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I have eaten a vegan diet for almost a decade now. This is the first book that makes me really excited about cooking. (1) approachable recipes (2) sensible health recommendations (3) great meal planning strategy.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Leftwich

customer_reviews.title: New and interesting vegan dishes!
customer_reviews.text: I really like the different plant based recipes in here - especially the breakfast items. I made the "slow cooker coconut brown rice" and do this almost every week now. It's amazing! I love waking up to a healthy warm breakfast to keep me on track all day! Thank you for bringing more creative plant based dishes to the table!
customer_reviews.author: Mom with boys

customer_reviews.title: No Meat Athlete Cookbook
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this cookbook but sadly I was under-whelmed. Very basic & uncreative. Nothing I hadn’t already figured out by myself
customer_reviews.author: Sousou

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing plant based cookbook for serious and casual athletes alike
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing plant based cookbook for serious and casual athletes alike. The recipes are easy to understand, have easily accessible ingredients, and my favorite--the food photos! Even simple recipes like avocado toast come alive and inspire me to venture out with new topping ideas. I like the easy-going style of recipe creation and how Matt and Stepfanie encourage the reader to make the recipes their own. You feel like you are cooking with them as a team member and not going solo in the kitchen all alone. It's a book that I'm sure I'll turn to again and again as I continue on my plant based journey. -- Tina
customer_reviews.author: Brian P. Ahern

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this book
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this book!!! I've loved every recipe I've tried. The suggestions for managing the overall planning and cooking process are very practical and helpful. All family members I've fed from it have loved the food - and that's saying a lot! It's a win-win-win for me - I love the food, it's healthy food, it makes planning and cooking easier, and - toughest of all - my family loves the food. I'm thrilled with it.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Massagee

customer_reviews.title: Good reference book for plant based diet.
customer_reviews.text: I skip the 43 pages of long introduction. Actual receipes starts at page 44. I try the page 92 receipe ( blueprint: better than takeout curry) and my family love the dish. It was huge success! The reason I try that receipe was because the picture looked great.
customer_reviews.author: Mamo

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad they're catering towards athletes who don't eat meat. I've been waiting for this for quite some time.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Good for the whole family
customer_reviews.text: I love the blog and have a couple of Matt Frazier's training guides, so picking up this cookbook was a given. So far, the omni fam and I all enjoy what I've made (granted, mostly dessert items, but that's how I ease them into enjoying plant-based goodness). If you're looking for plant-based fuel for your fitness goals or just looking for a heathier menu, this is a good guide.
customer_reviews.author: Sherrie Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Terrific book for new plant-based eaters
customer_reviews.text: I recently went plant-based and grabbed this book at the library. Kept renewing it until finally I just bought it. So many good recipes that are far more interesting than your basic salad, yet also not a melange of complex recipes that have 50 ingredients, Perfect book for ppl looking to clean up their food habits and still look forward to lunch. I've been meal prepping with the book with very happy results. Personally, I recommend the strawberry pistachio salad...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Books like this are helping me achieve that goal
customer_reviews.text: As an athlete I want to go 100% vegan. Books like this are helping me achieve that goal. I am probably at 80% now but this will bump that up.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Padilla

customer_reviews.title: Cookbook
customer_reviews.text: This is my second vegan cookbook I have bought. Very informative. I like everything about this cookbook and they make it very easy to start eating more plant base. I am very pleased with this book.
customer_reviews.author: thejacksoncrew

customer_reviews.title: Best vegan cookbook
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and another cookbook but this one definitely wins the prize. I’ve used it for practically every meal this month.
customer_reviews.author: Veronika

customer_reviews.title: Power Lifter loves N M A
customer_reviews.text: Really great variety of meals to satisfy all occasions & tastes. As a 115 kg (250 lb) power lifter I found plenty of recipes to fuel gruelling workouts & get some great gainz ! Eating a variety of plant foods is the secret to optimum athletic good health
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great recipe book for beginners!
customer_reviews.text: We are new to vegetarian cooking so this is the perfect book for busy athletes who don’t have a lot of time to spend in the kitchen. The recipes are easy to follow and delicious!
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia Aponte

customer_reviews.title: Great for athletes and vegetarians!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my daughter who is a gymnast and horse back rider. She is also vegetarian. There are great recipes in here and really good information. Great cookbook!
customer_reviews.author: Hope

customer_reviews.title: Yum!
customer_reviews.text: Everything I've made from this cookbook has been easy to make and delicious. I wish it had nutritional info for the recipes, but that's my only issue. It's also a gorgeous cookbook with glossy pictures and a useful index.
customer_reviews.author: LL

customer_reviews.title: it looks absolutely perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: I have followed the blog for years, finally got my hands on this book now that I'm getting back into running. I am excited to get cooking, it looks absolutely perfect for me!
customer_reviews.author: Smist

customer_reviews.title: You don’t know how much calorie you got!
customer_reviews.text: Great recipes but none of recipes has nutrition information! What’s the point writing a cookbook for athletes and not giving them a real information they need.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy recipes
customer_reviews.text: My favorite weeknight go to cookbook. Quick and easy and delicious. My favorite is the pineapple black bean bowl.
customer_reviews.author: E. Coombes

customer_reviews.title: Great recipes!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome easy cookbook! Made 3 different meal the first week I got it! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: papa

customer_reviews.title: Very creative WFPB recipes
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly international recipes and excellent! Vegan athletes perform better. I am not one but as a chef I appreciate these simpler, delicious ideas
customer_reviews.author: Jazzed

customer_reviews.title: Great cookbook for everyone
customer_reviews.text: I am not an athlete but I love this cookbook. The whole food plant based recipes are great- a good variety of everything from smoothies and electrolyte drinks to desserts. I also love the variety of salad dressing recipes. Remembering the blueprint (a grain, a bean, a green) is an easy way to make a healthy, filling meal. The sample meal plan also helps.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia R

customer_reviews.title: Easy Healthy Meals
customer_reviews.text: This book is wonderful! I have made 4 recipes so far and they all turned out great. They are healthy and easy to make. My teenage son made the spicy Italian Bean Balls and they were amazing. It's great to have some new dishes to add to our rotation. I can't wait to try more of the recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Whole food, plant based, and no oil
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the two cookbooks I use every week. I love that there are no-oil options for every recipe. The smoky potato salad over greens and the nut-crusted tofu are two of my favorite dishes to eat.
customer_reviews.author: C. Marker

customer_reviews.title: Love this cookbook
customer_reviews.text: Love this cookbook. Has made the transition to WFPB much easier for me. Although not an athlete, I do find many of the recipes more enticing than some of the other WFPB cookbooks I have reviewed. Keep up the good work.
customer_reviews.author: RTA

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best vegan cookbook I ever purchased! My whole family loves it and the recipes are easy to make.
customer_reviews.author: J DeBellis

customer_reviews.title: Great recipes! Another plant base book that I highly ...
customer_reviews.text: Great recipes! Another plant base book that I highly recommend! Great information! Brandon Frazier is awesome and what I love about this book is that there's so many good ideas in the book. If you're bored with food, give these recipes a try! You'll love them!
customer_reviews.author: Bella

customer_reviews.title: ... for my first marathon and this cookbook has been super great in helping me know what to eat for ...
customer_reviews.text: Been training for my first marathon and this cookbook has been super great in helping me know what to eat for training and recovery. Besides the recipes being delicious, they're also pretty easy! Love this cookbook! It's my favorite! You should get it too.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Awesome book!
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy this book, there are a lot of good and easy recipes that are easy to follow, they come out delicious!
customer_reviews.author: Alena

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic choice
customer_reviews.text: So happy I got this book. As a new vegetarian, it really explained everything. Took me from beginning to end on the science behind it and gave exciting, easy recipes. Very happy. I would recommend for sure.
customer_reviews.author: cristina

customer_reviews.title: Great for the active and not so active people who ...
customer_reviews.text: Great for the active and not so active people who want easy quick tasty vegan meals in a flash. I like that he includes oil free ways to cook the recipes
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Love love love this cookbook
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this cookbook!!!! Not only is it FULL of great info for the beginning vegan it's also packed with wonderful tips for the seasoned vegan! The food combinations are incredible! I'm looking forward to making all of these dishes! Thank you Matt for you dedication to this book for all of us healthy vegans out there!
customer_reviews.author: staci holweger

customer_reviews.title: I have liked all the recipes I have tried and cook out ...
customer_reviews.text: I have liked all the recipes I have tried and cook out of this weekly. I also like the "blueprints" for recipes so you have tons of variety using a formula. Makes cooking a lot more flexible.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Meat and dairy free! Health food!
customer_reviews.text: A follow on from Matt's previous book "No Meat Athlete" which was a huge success. If you'rean athlete and you want to eat healthier then this is the right book. It's also dairy free! (And meat free incase you missed the title)
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Practical and delicious cookbook
customer_reviews.text: Awesome recipe book for athletes, families, or just anyone, with easy, delicious, and unique recipes and blueprints to craft your own. I loved the informational sections, too, really makes this a comprehensive cookbook to have laying around your kitchen. Looking forward to working my way through the recipes!
customer_reviews.author: ALR

customer_reviews.title: and amazing recipes that are easy to follow
customer_reviews.text: Tons of information, and amazing recipes that are easy to follow. So excited to have this gem on my shelf! What a perfect way to start the summer with substantial and CLEAN food ideas! My wife was vegetarian for five years before going vegan for the past year and a half, I've been vegan for a year, and sometimes it's easy to get in a rut with meal-planning. We are so grateful for this amazing new resource! ((The podcast is really great too! ))
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: lots of easy recipes to follow
customer_reviews.text: I like the type of recipes in this book. They're easy to follow and have ingredients that are on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Doreen

customer_reviews.title: A treasure trove of inspiration
customer_reviews.text: This book is a treasure trove of inspiration, motivation and delicious recipes for me and my family, recently turned vegetarian/almost vegan INCLUDING my D1 college soccer playing daughter! Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth J. Tarry-crowe

customer_reviews.title: Worth adding this cookbook to your shelf--it will quickly become a favorite!
customer_reviews.text: Although I'm not really an athlete, I have followed Matt Frazier's path as he leads athletes and the rest of us to a healthier plate, home and life. This cookbook is fantastic--for anyone eating a whole foods plant based diet, not just athletes. Of particular interest to me are the many "blueprints" he includes for making customizing recipes easy. I like having guidelines, and then being able to use what's in the fridge. I also love all the sauces and spice mixtures. These recipes have been well-tested and I've loved all I've tried so far! I am careful about adding new cookbooks to my already-full shelf, but this one is a must!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: We enjoy the recipes and the items in them are somewhat easy to find. In our small town it can be hard to find some items but we haven’t had that problem with these recipes. We have also learned a lot from the information provided inside the book.
customer_reviews.author: Stacia

customer_reviews.title: Big on Easy, Plant-Based Meals
customer_reviews.text: I have been following Matt and his team for over 4 years! I was so excited to see his cook book come to fruition! Love the recipes (I've tried Winter Sunshine Salad, Avocado Toast & Anti-Inflammatory Miso Soup) and am excited to try all of them! Thank you NMA & Matt for a great addition to my Plant Based Book Shelf!
customer_reviews.author: Amy P.

customer_reviews.title: Not a runner
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a runner, but this book inspired me to switch over to a *healthy* plant based diet. The thing that surprised me was how much extra energy I now have! I thought that I would be hungry after eating such simple meals, but now a salad made simply with greens and beans keeps me going for hours! Well done Matt and Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Sean Tretheway

customer_reviews.title: Lack of Nutritional Information is disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the first few chapters of the book. Entertaining and informative. Then I got to the recipes and was disappointed to find that most of the recipes lacked nutritional information. Oh, but there is a nice link that will take you to the No Meat Athlete webpage to view and download them. It is incredibly inconvenient, and makes it hard to choose what to make depending on your fitness/nutritional goals. It also comes across as a cheap way to get hits on your website. I’d recommend most folks just join a strong FB group or look at the 1000’s of free recipes online that contain that information and download it for free.
customer_reviews.author: Jarred Newman

customer_reviews.title: Great pictures of the dishes!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product! Cant wait to make some goodies! I do wish all recipes had the macros attached instead of having to go look them up.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Church

customer_reviews.title: Great recipes
customer_reviews.text: His book provides great information. I love the simple recipes. Quick and easy. A wide variety. You can even add your own twist to each recipe.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Great recipes
customer_reviews.text: Trying this no meat diet with my wife and we happened find this book. So far we’re loving it and all the recipes are awesome I’d highly recommend this book to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: alan

customer_reviews.title: For non vegans too!
customer_reviews.text: Our whole family loves the recipes we've made from this book. We are not vegan but try to eat as many plant based and whole foods as we can. This provides some delicous ways to add some plant based meals to every plate.
customer_reviews.author: Leann T.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent cookbook - bought as a gift for my vegan daughter. Delicious recipes and some great information.
customer_reviews.author: Terri S.

customer_reviews.title: There are some nice recipes in the book
customer_reviews.text: There are some nice recipes in the book. The problem is that the recipes are more complicated than advertised, steps seem to be missing in some recipes and ingredients are not always easy to find.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: I am a non-athlete
customer_reviews.text: I am an active 60+-year-old non-athlete. I bought this for my son and daughter in law. I have been reading and cooking my way thru this book. Now I have to order them another one because I am keeping this one. The oil free concept does not mean flavor free.
customer_reviews.author: walt

customer_reviews.title: Delicious and simple
customer_reviews.text: Great cookbook. I’ve enjoyed every recipe I have tried. Most are very simple.
customer_reviews.author: BeagleBuddie

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: Great balanced meals and lots of meal ideas. Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Sharla Ansett

customer_reviews.title: NO NUTRITION INFORMATION
customer_reviews.text: The book provides good recipes but why doesn't it provide nutrition information... very odd
customer_reviews.author: Kevin A. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Love this book!
customer_reviews.text: Love this book! As a plant based personal trainer, have been recommending it to my clients too.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea D.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic introduction to no meat eating.
customer_reviews.text: My introduction to no meat eating. Still my all time favourite.
customer_reviews.author: Georgina

customer_reviews.title: This book 'has the meat' on No Meat Diets
customer_reviews.text: Good Book with great advice on Health and is full of great recipes that suit my tastes perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ash

customer_reviews.title: I love this book
customer_reviews.text: I love this book! I have read all of the opening chapters and looked thru the receipes. Just made the One Pot Pasta and Chia Pudding. So easy and delicious. Matt Frazier's website is well worth your time checking out.
customer_reviews.author: anon

customer_reviews.title: Great cookbook
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic cook book with lots of delicious recipes plus lots of info for obtaining a balanced diet whilst training on a vegan diet. I have been struggling to find some of the ingredients in the UK but will persevere!
customer_reviews.author: Easden89

customer_reviews.title: LOVED this book and I am a meat eater
customer_reviews.text: LOVED this book and I am a meat eater! A cornucopia of recipies sure to find several pleasers for even the pickiest eater. Could not believe they packed so many recipies and info into one gorgeous book. Already ordered a few more for gifts to my veg friends.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Awesome recipes! Go vegan and leave animal cruelty off your plate!
customer_reviews.author: Samiam71

customer_reviews.title: ... a few of the meals from the book—they were pretty good. Better than several plant based diet cookbooks ...
customer_reviews.text: Made a few of the meals from the book—they were pretty good. Better than several plant based diet cookbooks I’ve bought.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very excited to have this great book. Excellent source for me as a (mostly) vegan runner.
customer_reviews.author: Gail G

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great recipes and dietary advice. Now if I can only get myself to use it more often...
customer_reviews.author: Thomas D. Zumwalt

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the best vegan cookbook I have come across
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best vegan cookbook I have come across. The recipes are all delicious and relatively easy to make.
customer_reviews.author: luceyseto

customer_reviews.title: My vegan son-in-law already has found several useful suggestions from the book to supplement his training regiment ...
customer_reviews.text: My vegan son-in-law already has found several useful suggestions from the book to supplement his training regiment for his "iron man" lifestyle.
customer_reviews.author: charlie

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful book! Simple and easy to follow recipes that ...
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful book! Simple and easy to follow recipes that you will totally fall in love with. <3
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Excell

customer_reviews.title: Fun cookbook with good and healthy recipes
customer_reviews.text: I am not a vegan, but I enjoy mixing up what I eat here and there. This cookbook has tons of great recipes that will fill you up and provides good options to start mixing in meatless meals if you're interested in taking animal products out of your diet. I really enjoy cooking from this book and would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Alex N

customer_reviews.title: Simple but delicious meals easy and yet super nutritional !
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic book for vegan cooking . Super easy and the recipes taste amazing!!! Not at all overwhelming , easy to follow directions and simple. I highly reccomend this book!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Got a vegetarian all excited
customer_reviews.text: Really good looking recipes and ideas for meal prep and planning! My husband is vegetarian and he is so excited to start cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn Forner

customer_reviews.title: Must-have
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! Love it. It really made my transition sooo easy.
customer_reviews.author: Pascal Masuba

customer_reviews.title: ... cooking out of it and all recipes have been amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: On the third week of cooking out of it and all recipes have been amazing!!!
customer_reviews.author: Abigail

customer_reviews.title: Nutrition?
customer_reviews.text: Very few of the recipes included nutrition facts. That is CRITICAL to someone trying to train. Major fail for this book.
customer_reviews.author: R. Sparks

customer_reviews.title: good looking and it only gets better inside
customer_reviews.text: You can judge a book by it's cover. It is slick, good looking and it only gets better inside. Amazing recipes for vegans and non-vegans, for athletes and non-athletes, as well as for aspiring vegetarian/vegans. Well worth it. Run to your computer and purchase it.
customer_reviews.author: L. Rosell

customer_reviews.title: Great book. Great recipes
customer_reviews.text: So much creativity in the ingredients (miso and umeboshi). Finally something different and bold. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: All the recipes we've tried are so good. I love that they are quick to make ...
customer_reviews.text: Loving this cookbook so far! All the recipes we've tried are so good. I love that they are quick to make and easy to follow. I'm definitely finding this book to be the missing link in fully removing meat from my house and my recipe list!
customer_reviews.author: shaneh

customer_reviews.title: Great GF Options
customer_reviews.text: As someone who has celiac and tries to be vegan it's tough to get a lot of good recipes without putting a lot of effort into it. This book is great in that it's all in one place for those days I am feeling lazy when it comes to my meal prep.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Try the Tabouli recipe first!
customer_reviews.text: I've made one recipe; the Taboule. Turned out fab. Its made the rotation!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous Book
customer_reviews.text: So helpful! Answered all my questions! The recipes look amazing, and the helpful hints are sure to save u time!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... already tell that this will be one of my favorite cookbooks (and I have probably about 20 plant-based cookbooks)
customer_reviews.text: I have only had chance to try a few of the recipes so far but I can already tell that this will be one of my favorite cookbooks (and I have probably about 20 plant-based cookbooks). WIe have 4 boys who did not originally grow up eating a plant-based diet and I have really struggled to help them transition to plant-based. Recently I have been having my boys flip through cookbooks and put sticky notes on recipes that they would be willing to try. This book got the most stickies of any! The photos are beautiful and the book is well organized. The recipes are also not super long and complicated like some vegan cookbooks. This one is a winner!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent book! Well worth the money. So many delicious recipes. Easy to follow directions.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget M.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Practical, insightful, and applicable to everyone -- athlete or not!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Loved the book. Love the Blog! Love the Podcast!!!!! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: mary c brannan

customer_reviews.title: Great book, but not the end all be all
customer_reviews.text: Great book, especially to get me excited about cooking vegan meals! The only downside is that his baking recipes are a bit off. I say that because numerous recipes that require baking I have tried and they are never "quite right", even if I follow the recipe to a T.
customer_reviews.author: richard churak

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the active veg athlete's nutrition library
customer_reviews.text: I've been a fan of Matt for a while and have found his marathon roadmap and nutrition advice extremely helpful. I was very excited to see this cookbook was coming out. The recipes are fun and creative, but down-to-earth,very useful to the plant-based athlete with families to feed. I've already used the suggestion to soak my grains and legumes to great effect!
customer_reviews.author: TermsandConditions

customer_reviews.title: Recipes are easy to follow, and delicious! Great intro to plant-based lifestyle, without the preaching.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great book. As I'm new to plant based recipes and lifestyle, I found this book informative, fun, and not at all preachy in its message. The recipes are actually delicious and easy to put together. Easy to read with beautiful accompanying images. Especialy liked the hearty breakfast recipe options that a good change from the usual vegan staple of a smoothie.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Maan

customer_reviews.title: Great addition
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this and it is filled with so many amazing recipes that I can't decide which one to make first. My family will be eating recipes for weeks from this book!
customer_reviews.author: Peter J. Flagg

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing recipes for plant-based athletes, and anybody who wants to eat better
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo

product_meta.title: The No Meat Athlete Cookbook: Whole Food, Plant-Based Recipes to Fuel Your Workouts—and the Rest of Your Life
